team.name: Paul Tepsich
team.description:
I founded High Rock Capital in 2010.  Prior to founding High Rock, I worked at Merrill Lynch Canada Inc for over 17 years trading all sectors of the Canadian fixed income market but with a particular focus on high yield, distressed debt and capital structure arbitrage.  It was there I developed deep fundamental research and financial modeling skills.  I was Head of Canadian Credit Trading at Merrill Lynch Canada Inc. and was responsible for portfolios totaling up to $13 billion until my departure in 2008.  

From 2009 until 2010, I was a Portfolio Manager at a Toronto and Calgary-based investment firm, where I was the lead manager for two newly formed long/short high yield bond funds.  The firm’s flagship high yield fund was a top-quartile performer while I was the lead portfolio manager. 

​At High Rock, I am the Portfolio Manager on the funds we manage for Scotiabank in our Institutional division as well as our Private Client models.  My work is largely focused on "bottom-up" fundamental research.  I am also the Chief Compliance Officer at High Rock.  

I am a frequent guest speaker on BNN and have been a guest lecturer (3yrs) for Queen's University, Master of Finance, where I lectured on Credit, High Yield, Distressed Debt and Fundamental Analysis/Modeling (no one fell asleep during my tenure). 

I grew up in Burlington and attended Nelson High School but have lived in Toronto for over 30 years.  I am luckily married to my wife Nancy and try very hard to keep up to our three sons, Macallum (skiing), Harrison (basketball) and Nicholas (snowboard racing) (no small task).  I have been actively involved in the cycling community in Toronto and am a former Board Member of the Morning Glory Cycling Club where I initiated and chaired the Club's philanthropy committee.   I am an avid road cyclist, runner, skier and a passionate outdoorsman.  

I hold a BA Financial Studies/Economics (1985) from King's College (University of Western Ontario) and a CFA charterholder (1991).
